page.title: 18A typical farm in Hurworth
page.content: Oxen_Le_Fields is a 240 acre mixed arable family farm, which has been passed down since 1912. The farm itself dates back to the 11 century. The crops grown are: winter and spring wheat, barley, peas, beans, potatoes, grass and oilseed rape. The wheat goes to a Newcastle flour mill, barley is for malting (to a farming co_operative), beans for animal feed, potatoes sold to local merchants, the grass used for hay and silage. The oilseed rape goes to crushing mills at Hull and Liverpool. There is a herd of 25 beef cows. The calves are reared until one year old and then sold. Three people work full time on the farm, and there is much machinery. The farm receives some subsidies from the Common Market eg. for oilseed rape.
